content.text: In this lesson, you'll learn how to plan a trip with a friend. Let's start with how to ask about their plans.

data.tip: The Dutch 'w' is softer than in English, almost like a 'v' sound.

data.phrase: Heb je plannen voor het weekend?
data.meaning: Do you have plans for the weekend?

content.text: To suggest an activity, you can start with 'We gaan...' which means 'We are going...'.
You can also use 'We kunnen...' which means 'We can...' to suggest possibilities.

content.title: Proposing an Idea
content.setting: You are talking to your friend, Alex, about the upcoming weekend.

conversation_flow.title: Greet Alex and ask how they are
Ask if they have plans for the weekend
Suggest going to a city
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Ik heb geen plannen. Heb je een idee?

extract_info.city_name: Extract the name of the city the user suggests

conversation_flow.title: Suggest an activity to do there
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: {city_name}! Leuk! Wat kunnen we daar doen?

content.text: Great start! Now let's discuss the details. To ask 'how', you use the word 'hoe'.
When suggesting a specific time in Dutch, you use the word 'om' for 'at'.

data.tip: The 'ch' sound is a soft, throaty sound, like the 'ch' in the Scottish word 'loch'.

content.text: To ask for someone's opinion on a plan, you can say 'Wat vind je van het plan?'

data.phrase: Wat vind je van het plan?
data.meaning: What do you think of the plan?

content.title: Discussing Logistics
content.setting: You've suggested a city and an activity. Now it's time to figure out the details.

conversation_flow.title: Suggest a mode of transport
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Een museum bezoeken is een goed idee. Hoe gaan we naar {city_name}?

conversation_flow.title: Suggest a time to meet
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Ja, met de trein is goed. Wanneer gaan we?

conversation_flow.title: Ask for their opinion on the plan
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Zaterdag om tien uur is perfect voor mij.

content.text: Almost done! Let's learn how to confirm the plan and express excitement. You can use 'Dus...' to mean 'So...' when summarizing.

data.tip: The end of the word, '-tion', is pronounced like '-tsjon'.

content.text: A common and enthusiastic way to say you're looking forward to something is 'Ik heb er zin in!'

content.title: Finalizing the Plan
content.setting: You've agreed on the basic logistics. Now, confirm everything and close the conversation.

conversation_flow.title: Confirm the plan to go to the city
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Ik vind het een heel goed plan!

conversation_flow.title: Suggest a meeting place
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Ja, super! Waar spreken we af?

conversation_flow.title: Express your excitement
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Perfect. Zaterdag om tien uur op het station.
